definition: lit. badly burned about the head (from trying to put out a fire) (idiom)/fig. hard-pressed/under pressure (from a heavy workload, creditors etc)
burnt/scorched/charred/worried/anxious/coke/abbr. for 焦耳[jiao1 er3], joule
surname Jiao
head/hair style/the top/end/beginning or end/a stub/remnant/chief/boss/side/aspect/first/leading/classifier for pigs or livestock/CL:個|个[ge4]
suffix for nouns
soft/mushy/well-cooked and soft/to rot/to decompose/rotten/worn out/chaotic/messy/utterly/thoroughly/crappy/bad
forehead/horizontal tablet or inscribed board/specified number or amount

sentences.english: It’s easy to get caught up in the mile-long to-do list of preparations.
sentences.chinese: 你很容易被冗長的籌備清單搞得焦頭爛額。

sentences.english: "Let us now is about to publish the muttering about the new" law of post.
sentences.chinese: 現在讓我們焦頭爛額的是即將出臺的新《郵政法》。

sentences.english: I will surely be bonded by those worldly affairs, which might make me tired and in bad shape.
sentences.chinese: 這些俗事必定把我的時間綁死，令我累的焦頭爛額。

sentences.english: This series of major, let nakamura and Mr Busy.
sentences.chinese: 這一系列的大案，讓中村和福田忙的焦頭爛額。
